title: Splash Page
custom_preconds: GIVEN web app is opened on browser

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the splash page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with

* MLB Play logo
* 'Play the Hits!'
* copy 'Available on web and mobile platforms.'
* 'Play Now on Web' CTA
* 'Download on the App Store' and 'Get it on Google Play' buttons
* Available Games sections with 'NO PURCHASE NECESSARY. 18+. Restrictions apply; click for Official Rules.' copy
* 'Unlock Your Favorite Teams and Players' and 'Play with Friends' section
* Featured Game section
* 'Frequently Asked Questions' section
* footer (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Official Rules page opens

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN login page is opened in a new tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on go to FAQ page link

https://www.mlb.com/help/play/frequently-asked-questions?partnerId=playapp-web_referral&rsid=mlbglobal08&adobe_mc=MCMID%3D88911663233712466721925388166008910296%7CMCORGID%3DA65F776A5245B01B0A490D44%2540AdobeOrg%7CTS%3D1654114564

title: FAQ section
custom_preconds: GIVEN web app is opened on browser

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the arrow button on 'What is MLB Play?'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees the copy:
MLB Play is our destination for all free-to-play predictive and trivia games for MLB. You can play these great games for FREE using your MLB.com account. MLB Play is accessible on MLB.com/play and for download via the App Store and Google Play.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on MLB Play account
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the mlb.com page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on MLB.com/play
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN is brought to MLB Play login page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the arrow button on 'How do I win Prizes or earn virtual Reward Packs in MLB Play?'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees the copy:
Prizes are won by completing certain achievements, like getting the “Bingo” badge. For a complete list of relevant achievements and their associated Prizes, see the MLB Play Prizes page. Reward Packs are earned by accruing Tokens. As you play MLB Play’s various games, you’ll accrue Tokens. Accrue enough Tokens and you’ll automatically earn a Reward Pack.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on MLB Play Prizes page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN https://www.mlb.com/apps/play/prizes?partnerId=playapp-web_referral&rsid=betamlbglobal&adobe_mc=MCMID%3D59681424876131801774354390327407840133%7CMCORGID%3DA65F776A5245B01B0A490D44%2540AdobeOrg%7CTS%3D1681923531 page is opened

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the arrow button on 'What is Beat the Streak?'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees the copy:
Beat the Streak is a free-to-play contest where fans predict an MLB player to get a hit. If fans build a streak of 57 correct picks (beating baseball’s famous 56-game hitting streak), they could win $5.6 Million. You must be 21 or older to participate in Beat the Streak. See Beat the Streak’s Official Rules here.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN https://www.mlb.com/apps/beat-the-streak/official-rules page opens

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the arrow button on 'What does “Pass” mean?'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees the copy:
Beat the Streak allows you to keep your Streak at its then-current level (rather than break and revert to zero) under certain limited conditions that we call a Pass. One example is if the batter you picked never entered the game. See the “Scoring” section of the Official Rules for details on all Pass scenarios.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN https://www.mlb.com/apps/beat-the-streak/official-rules page opens

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the arrow button on 'What is a Streak Saver and how do I get one?'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees the copy:
Streak Saver is a special, one-time way for your Streak to continue when it would have otherwise ended. When your Streak is at least 10 and no more than 15, if your pick fails to hit (or Pass), Streak Saver will “save” your Streak and keep it at its then current number. Streak Saver is automatically available for all fans. No action required! But Streak Saver will only make such a save once during the entire season. After Streak Saver saves your Streak, it is no longer available and will not save your future Streaks. See the Official Rules for more detail.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN https://www.mlb.com/apps/beat-the-streak/official-rules page opens

title: Sign Up
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play web app is opened on browser
AND user is going through the Sign Up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on the Sign Up page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with: 
* 'Sign Up' title
* back arrow on the top left corner
* copy "Create an MLB account to play the games and get access to exclusive MLB content'
* Email Address, Nickname, Password, Birthday MM/DD/YY and Country of Residence fields
* Legal copy 'By signing up, I acknowledge that I have read, understand, and agree to be bound by MLB Play’s Official Rules, MLB's Terms of Use and MLB’s Privacy Policy.'
* Sign Up button (disabled)
*'Have an account already? Log In' copy


AND all fields are required and have asterisks

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Official Rules page opens in a webview (link is TBD)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Terms of Use
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Terms of Use Agreement page opens in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Privacy Policy
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN MLB Privacy Policy page opens in a webview

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters the information in all the fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Sign Up button becomes blue and active

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects any field and it's in focus
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the field has a blue outline

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters incorrect input for any field besides Country of Residence and Province
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the field has a red outline and the error message underneath it

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Welcome page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Log In'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to Log In page

title: Sign Up - Birthdate
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Birthdate field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should see:
* the field placeholder 'Birthdate MM/DD/YYYY'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a future birthdate
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with “Please enter a correct birthdate” message

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid birthdate
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with: 'Please enter your birthday in the format mm/dd/yyyy' message

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a birthdate which is under 21
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with: 'You must be at least 21 years of age to access MLB Play.'
AND a cookie should be placed on my device that marks me as ineligible. Any time I open the app again, I should be shown the Ineligible Page and only the Ineligible Page.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a birthday which is 21+
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN no error message should appear
AND user should be able to continue the sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters year older than 122 years
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives an error message 'Please enter a correct birthdate'

title: Sign Up - Nickname
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user goes through the Sign up flow
custom_steps: WEHN User on Nickname field during the Sign Up
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to enter nickname ( 6-15 Character / Letter and numbers only) 



If User leave empty or does not met requirement - User should display with enter valid nickname) 

iOS - Nickname must be 6-15 character long 
Android - First we display message - 6-15 Character 
If User enter special character then display message - only letters and numbers

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Nickname field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN nickname criteria should be: 

* nicknames should not be unique
must be 6-15 characters long
* must contain only letters and numbers
* can not contain spaces and special characters
* can not contain non-English characters
* can not be disruptive or offensive
* can not contain emoji

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters nickname that is shorter than 6 characters or longer than 15
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should see the error message


iOS - Nickname must be 6-15 character long 
Android - First we display message - 6-15 Character

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters nickname with special character
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should see the error message 'Nickname mush contain only letters and numbers

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters disruptive or offensive nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should see the error message 'Please choose another nickname'

title: Sign Up - Email field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an Invalid email
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the line is turned red with the text “Please enter a valid email address”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user puts the space
custom_steps_separated.expected: THE the error message appears: 'The first character must be a letter or number'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters a valid email

valid emails include:

user@gmail.com
user+@gmail.com
user-@gmail.com
user?@gmail.com
user=/-+@gmail.com
user%20@gmail.com
andi2019p@mlb.com
custom_steps_separated.expected: WHEN the field accepts the email and throws no error message

title: Sign Up - Password field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is creating a password
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see the following password requirements and must make a password fitting the following password requirements:
 - No special characters
 - One number
 - One uppercase letter
 - One lowercase letter
 - 8-15 characters

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the corresponding issues with the password should be red with an X in the requirements field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a valid password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN all the password requirements should have a check mark next to them

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks the eyeball after entering a password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the text in the password field should become visible

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB PLay app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees the splash page (separate TC)

title: Sign Up - error messages
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user goes through the Sign up flow

custom_steps_separated.content: WEHN user enters an invalid email address in Email Address field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Please enter a valid email address'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN enters a nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with a pop up window with Nickname requirements.
AND user will be displayed with Red color for invalid entries and green checkmark for the valid entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Nickname must be 6-15 characters long'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters Password on the Password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with checkmark against the requirement for the password 

Note: All options are displayed below the Password and user will be displayed with Red color for invalid entries and checkmark filled with white background for the valid entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN enters a password
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with a pop up window with Password requirements.
AND user will be displayed with Red color for invalid entries and green checkmark for the valid entry

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Password and clicks on another text field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Your password does not meet the requirement'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a password of less than 8 characters or more than 15 characters
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'Password is not between 8 and 15 characters'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters unmatching Password in Confirm Password field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with an error message 'The password you entered does not match this input'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters matching Password and then updates the password in the first field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'Passwords do not match' error message

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters the value in 'Confirm password' field first
AND then enters the same password in the first password field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN no error messages in displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Birthdate field and enters a birthday > 21 year old
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'You must be at least 21 years of age to access MLB Play'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on Birthdate field and enters a future date or incorrect month and day
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with an error messages
'Month is invalid'
'Day is invalid'
'Year is invalid'
'You must be at least 21 years of age to access MLB Play'

title: 'Forgot Password?' link
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND the user has existing account
AND the user is on Log In page
custom_expected: THEN Reset Password Page is shown allowing user to reset their password

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password will be shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND beneath the header there is text to instruct the user to reset password
* [Android] - Forgot Password 

Recover your Account
"Email Address field . We'll send you an email with a link to reset your password."
* [iOS] - Then user display with Web url https://www.mlb.com/forgot-password

for reseting the password 

Forgot Password 
Please enter your e-mail address below and we'll send a link to reset your password.
Email field 
Reset Password radio button
AND an email field is shown above 'Submit' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN email address input field is unpopulated
and the "submit" button is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address." (this is within the app) 
* [iOS] - Open Web link to fill the form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address that does not conform to standard email rules (i.e @ symbol missing, domain missing)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address."
* [iOS] - TODO: CONFIRM

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user disables the network (setting device to airplane mode is one way to achieve this)
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an error prompt is shown
* [Android] "Reset Password Failed." - "Password recovery failed."
* [iOS] - TODO: CONFIRM

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user enables the network
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND the email field and submit are no longer shown, INSTEAD is shown "Reset password instructions have been sent to your email."

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses their email containing a Reset Password link
AND user completes needed actions to successfully reset the password
AND user returns to MLB PREDICT app (Reset Password page, if prev minimized)
AND user logs in with new password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is logged in successfully with newly reset password.

title: Log In flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user has an MLB account

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB Play app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with splash screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Log in with MLB' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with Log In page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters Email Address and Password 
AND clicks on 'Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Games tab

title: Log In - error messages
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is going through Log In flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters invalid email and valid password 
AND clicks on 'Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'Please enter a valid email address'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid email, invalid password 
AND clicks on 'Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user should be displayed with 'Please enter a valid email/Password'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters valid email and password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN no error message is dusplayed

title: Log In - new account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play web app is opened on browser
AND user created an account after the Onboarding flow was updated (Country of Residence was added)
AND user is Logged Out

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user Logs back In
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is able to proceed to the app successfully 
AND does not need to update an account 
AND 'Update Your Account' page is not displayed

title: Update your Account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user has existing account with missing nickname
AND user is on Log In page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with Update Your Account page

* 'Update Your Account' title
* back arrow in the top left corner
* 'Please update your account with the necessary information to access MLB Play.' copy
Nickname, Birthdate, Country of Residence field
* 'If your country is not listed, choose “Other”' copy underneath the Country of Residence field
* “By updating your account and logging into MLB Play, you consent to the Official Rules of MLB Play.”'
* 'Update & Log In' button
* 'Don’t have an account? Sign Up' copy

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN it should open the Official Rules page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the back arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought back to the splash page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters an invalid Nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the error message is displayed 'Nickname must contain only letters and numbers'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters a valid Nickname
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Update & Log In' button gets active

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user fills all 3 fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN 'Update & Log In' button gets active

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters correct information
AND clicks on 'Update & Log In' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to Games tab

title: Update Your Account - Country of Residence
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play web app is opened on browser
AND user is going through the Log In flow
AND user is on the 'Update Your Account' page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the 'Country of Residence' field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees 'Country of Residence' inside the field
AND 'Country of Residence' is not pre-filled
AND copy 'If your country is not listed, choose “Other”' is displayed underneath the text field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on that field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Country of Residence' moved to the top borderline
AND drop down list appears

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls through the drop down list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with a drop-down list with the following countries in order:

United States
Australia
Canada
China
Colombia
Cuba
Dominican Republic
France
Germany
India
Israel
Italy
Japan
Mexico
Netherlands
Panama
Puerto Rico
South Korea
Taiwan
United Kingdom
Venezuela
Other

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects Canada
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN an additional drop-down field is displayed (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects any other country
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN no additional drop-down field is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects Country of Residence
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Sign Up button gets active

title: Update Your Account - Province
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play web app is opened on browser
AND user is going through the Log In flow
AND user is on the 'Update Your Account' page
AND user selected Canada as Residence

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects Canada
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an additional drop-down field is displayed asking them to declare their Province (listed in alphabetical order)

Alberta
British Columbia
Manitoba
New Brunswick
Newfoundland and Labrador
Northwest Territories
Nova Scotia
Nunavut
Ontario
Prince Edward Island
Quebec
Saskatchewan
Yukon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects a province
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Sign UP button gets active
